alert.note: Alert for Santa Rosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 1:54AM EDT until June 16 at 4:45AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Florida, including the following counties, Escambia and Santa Rosa. * WHEN...Until 400 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1254 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pace, Bagdad, Navarre, Pea Ridge, Floridatown, Navarre Beach, Galt City, Harp, Mulat, Ward Basin, Pine Bluff, Woodlawn Beach, Holley, Harper, Cottage Hill and Quintette.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
